title: Fake News: Gucci Mane Did NOT File For Divorce After Finding Out Wife Keyshia Ka'Oir Smashed Jeezy a Decade Ago | Lead Stories
subtitle: Did Rapper Gucci Mane file for divorce after finding out his wife slept with his rival Young Jeezy a decade...
author: leadstories.com
vclaim:
Did Rapper Gucci Mane file for divorce after finding out his wife slept with his rival Young Jeezy a decade ago? No, that's not true: the story was put out almost a month ago by a site that regularily puts out false news (including death hoaxes) about celebrities to attract clicks and then hides behind a satire disclaimer at the bottom of the page that you can clearly read if you have a big magnifying glass.

The an article published by LFR Solutions on September 28, 2019 only went viral late in October 2019. It was titled "Gucci Mane Files For Divorce After Finding Out Wife Keyshia Ka'Oir Smashed Jeezy a Decade Ago!" (archived here) and it opened:

Users on social media only saw this title, description and thumbnail:

Gucci Mane Files For Divorce After Finding Out Wife Keyshia Ka'Oir Smashed Jeezy a Decade Ago! According to sources close to Gucci Mane and Keyshia Ka'Oir, the two are preparing to split just weeks before their third year anniversary. It was confirmed that Gucci Mane filed for divorce after he found out that his wife had a prior intimate relationship with his arch nemesis and rival, Young Jeezy a decade prior ...

The site LFR Solutions comes with a disclaimer at the bottom of every page that reads:

However that disclaimer is between four and five pixels tall so it is hardly legible on most screens. To us that indicates deception is going on so in accordance with our Satire Policy we rate this story "False".

Neither Gucci Mane (real name Radric Delantic Davis) nor Young Jeezy (or just Jeezy these days, real name Jay Wayne Jenkins) have made any comment about the supposed divorce on social media. In fact, just three days ago Mane and his wife posted pictures to Instagram celebrating their second wedding anniversary:

We wrote about lfrsolutions.com before, here are our most recent articles that mention the site:

• Fake News: NO Salmonella Outbreak Across Georgia, NOT Linked To Popeye's Chicken Sandwich
• Fake News: Lil Nas X Did NOT Get Dropped From Wrangler Endorsement After Coming Out The Closet
• Fake News: R&B Legend Sisqo NOT Given 6 Months to Live, NOT Diagnosed With Advance Lupus
